variant.question: Which of the following summaries lists only directional antennae?

options.text: Loop antenna, parabolic antenna, slotted planar array antenna, helical antenna.
Dipole antenna, loop antenna, parabolic antenna, slotted planar array antenna.
Dipole antenna, sense antenna, parabolic antenna, helical antenna.
Sense antenna, parabolic antenna, slotted planar array antenna, helical antenna.

variant.question: Which of the following describes antenna shadowing?

options.text: The signal is blocked by the aircraft parts/structure.
The radar-reception antenna is protected from strong signals which are produced by a nearby transmission antenna.
Cloud behind another cloud can’t be seen.
Terrain blocking the path between transmitter and receiver/aircraft antenna.

variant.question: Which of the following lists only includes directional antennas?

options.text: Loop antenna, parabolic antenna, slotted planar antenna, helical antenna.
Dipole antenna, sense antenna, parabolic antenna, helical antenna.
Sense antenna, parabolic antenna, slotted planar array antenna, helical antenna.
Dipole antenna, loop antenna, parabolic antenna, slotted planar array antenna.

variant.question: Which of the following might be caused by antenna shadowing?

options.text: Poor radio reception of a VOR ident signal while the aircraft is making an orbit (360° medium-level turn).
An aircraft appearing as two distinct Indications on a radar controller's display.
Blocking of a VOR transmission caused by buildings close to the antenna.
A weather radar failing to show a distant turbulent cloud due to the signals being blocked by a nearer cloud.
